title: Struggling Norwich pick up first away point since return to Premier League by grinding out goalless draw at Bournemouth
text:
Norwich earned their first away point of the season with a spirited and resilient draw at Bournemouth.

Given the rate at which these sides had been scoring and conceding, this appeared the most unlikely outcome but it is one which should ultimately please Daniel Farke.

It is Bournemouth’s first goalless draw for a year and a forgettable afternoon for Callum Wilson and Ryan Fraser who made their 100 Premier League appearances.

These sides came into the game as the only remaining members of the Premier League yet to keep a clean sheet.

Norwich had already conceded a startling 21 goals but there was little goalmouth action throughout to excite supporters of either side.

Dominic Solanke is still looking for his first goal for Bournemouth and he registered the game’s first shot on target as he latched onto Wilson’s clever touch only to be prevented from scoring by Tim Krul’s save at the near post.
description: Norwich earned their first away point of the season with a spirited and resilient draw at Bournemouth.
